questions.clue: This inventor is often credited with creating peanut butter, although he mainly promoted peanuts as a crop in the early 20th century.
Peanut butter is a favorite treat for these animals, often used to hide medication or as a reward.
This famous food company, known for its jams and jellies, began selling peanut butter in 1928.
In 2021, this country was the largest producer of peanuts, a key ingredient in peanut butter.
The U.S. Food and Drug Administration requires that peanut butter must contain at least this percentage of peanuts.

categories.name: Famous Dogs in History & Pop Culture

questions.clue: This cartoon beagle made his first appearance in 1950 and loves to dream of being the Red Baron.
This popular internet meme features a Shiba Inu dog with captions in broken English like 'such wow' and 'very peanut butter'.
This brave terrier mix became the first animal to orbit Earth aboard Sputnik 2 in 1957.
This loyal dog waited for his deceased owner at a train station in Tokyo every day for nearly 10 years, inspiring the film 'Hachi: A Dog's Tale'.
In the 2008 Beijing Olympics opening ceremony, a performance featured this breed of dog known for its historical significance in China.
This famous structure, built to protect the Chinese states from invasions, stretches over 13,000 miles.
Discovered in 1974, these thousands of life-sized clay soldiers were buried with China's first emperor.
This ancient Chinese philosophical text, attributed to Laozi, explores the concept of 'Tao'.
These ancient divination texts were inscribed on bones or shells and used during the Shang Dynasty.
Dating back to 1046 BC, this dynasty's 'Book of Songs' is one of the oldest collections of Chinese poetry.
This creamy spread is often a favorite for dogs, who love its salty and sweet taste.
The taste sensation that detects the presence of sodium ions is known as this.
Dogs have fewer of these taste receptors than humans, which is why they savor different flavors.
This umami-rich ingredient, commonly used in Chinese cuisine, enhances the savory taste of dishes.
The principle that explains why taste perception can be affected by temperature, especially in foods like ice cream and hot soup.
In 1492, this Italian explorer set sail under the Spanish flag and discovered the Americas.
Lewis and Clark's expedition, from 1804 to 1806, explored lands west of the Mississippi River, aided by this Native American woman.
This Portuguese explorer was the first to round the southern tip of Africa, opening the way for a sea route to Asia.
In 1271, this Venetian merchant began his journey to China, later documenting his experiences in 'The Travels of Marco Polo.'
This Norwegian explorer was the first to successfully reach the South Pole in 1911, beating Robert Falcon Scott's British expedition.

final.clue: This inventor, credited with a process that improved food preservation, once famously said, 'My dog would prefer peanut butter over this.'
